newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan dollar closes weaker on foreign trend.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan dollar closes weaker on foreign trend.

text.p: The Taiwan dollar closed weaker against the U.S. dollar on Tuesday, reflecting the U.S. unit's strength in Tokyo and other overseas markets, dealers said.
The local dollar ended at T$27.485 to the U.S. dollar compared with Monday's already depreciated T$27.420 finish.
Turnover through dealers was a moderate US$392 million.
The U.S. dollar's strength against the yen prompted Taiwan importers to buy the greenback, adding to U.S. dollar demand from local banks, dealers said.
"U.S. dollar demand has been stronger than supply recently, a situation likely to continue," a foreign bank dealer said.
The local unit might test the T$27.50 level in coming sessions if the U.S. dollar remained strong in overseas markets, dealers said.
A T$27.45-50 trading range was seen for Wednesday.
